Block",rootIndex:10,response:null,propSetMap:{sanitize:false,textKey:"",HTMLTemplateId:"",dataJSON:false,show:{group:{rules:[{field:"successValue",condition:"=",data:"true"}],operator:"AND"}},text:'

Thank you for using the Health Connect Registry

\n

%firstName% %lastName% is no longer registered on the Health Connect Registry.

\n

If your situation changes and you need a primary care provider in the future, you can create a new registration

\n

If you need additional healthcare resources, you can find local health services and supports available in communities across B.C.

\n

To update the information submitted, please call 8-1-1.

',label:"TextBlock2",controlWidth:12},name:"TextBlock2",level:2,JSONPath:"successScreen:Block1|1:TextBlock2",indexInParent:1,index:0,children:[],bHasAttachment:false,bTextBlock:true,lwcId:"lwc10001-0"}],bHasAttachment:false},{response:null,level:2,indexInParent:2,eleArray:[{type:"Text Block",rootIndex:10,response:null,propSetMap:{sanitize:false,textKey:"",HTMLTemplateId:"",dataJSON:false,show:{group:{rules:[{field:"YesSelection",condition:"=",data:"true"}],operator:"AND"}},text:'

%firstName% %lastName% record has been successfully updated on the Health Connect Registry!

\n

What happens after you register

\n

Each community has a team that coordinates with local primary care providers. The team will be in touch when they have a suggested match, or if they need more information from you. You will then meet with the family doctor or nurse practitioner for an intake appointment.

\n

Keep your information up to date

\n

Call Healthlink BC at 8-1-1 if you need to:

\n
    \n
  • Update your address or contact information
    • \n
  • Inform us of new diagnoses or changes in your health
    • \n
  • Advise us if you\'re no longer looking for a family doctor or nurse practitioner in B.C.
    • \n
\n

If you need health services before you find a match

\n

We recognize finding a family doctor or nurse practitioner takes time. Currently, we are unable to estimate when you will be matched. In the meantime, find health services and supports available in your community.
